properties.displayName: _CSGP: AWS CloudTrail - Mass downloads of images from ECR from unexpected principals
properties.description:
Contributor(s): Nixy Camacho, Kamran Ahmadjan, Wajahat Malik
Reference: https://servicedesk.costargroup.com/browse/SEC-11667
Handling Guidance: 
- Reach out to the principal / user performing downloads (if applicable)
- Confirm with SecOps if an entity is seen performing this to ensure this is normal/expected activity.
- Investigate: Are there any other detections / correlated events that this same user principal triggered around the same time? Is the principal a real human user, or automated service account?
properties.query:
AWSCloudTrail
// | where TimeGenerated >= ago(30d) //uncomment for testing rule hits in last 30d
| where EventSource == "ecr.amazonaws.com"
| where EventName == "GetDownloadUrlForLayer" //or EventName == "BatchCheckLayerAvailability"
| where isnotempty(UserIdentityArn)
| where UserIdentityArn startswith "arn:aws:iam" // This shouldn't be done with a IAM user 
| where UserIdentityArn !in ("arn:aws:iam::103567893073:user/travis", "arn:aws:iam::614253799013:user/m2repo-s3", "arn:aws:iam::103567893073:user/jenkins-ecr")
| join kind=inner _GetWatchlist('aws-accounts') on $left.UserIdentityAccountId == $right.accountid
| summarize GetDownloadUrlForLayer_Count = countif(EventName == "GetDownloadUrlForLayer"), TotalDownloads = count() by name, UserIdentityArn, SourceIpAddress, UserAgent
| where TotalDownloads > 2
| project-rename Subscription = name, UserIdentityArn, SourceIpAddress, GetDownloadUrlForLayer_Count, TotalDownloads, UserAgent
